Articles.Content:
8 hours ago, dafidge9898 said:

Is it possible to change the actual size of the kerbals? I play realism overhaul, and would like my kerbals to be average human height, not three feet tall. 

Thank you! 

It is possible to resize kerbals in IVA (not with this mod, just Module Manager). See the Transmogrifer link in my sig. I admit it is of limited appeal without resizing EVA kerbals as well, but it would someone with more talent than me to figure out how to do that.

I made some skyboxes!

For those who are interested: Click Here
I wonder who is supporting TR's CKAN entry? It is outdated with CKAN thinking it's not compatible with KSP 1.4. Do you mind if I cross-post to CKAN thread for them to fix it?

On 8/1/2018 at 5:33 PM, garwel said:

I wonder who is supporting TR's CKAN entry? It is outdated with CKAN thinking it's not compatible with KSP 1.4. Do you mind if I cross-post to CKAN thread for them to fix it?

It's on CKAN now.
Is there a way to make Texture replacer allow kerbals take off there suits at Duna?

8 hours ago, KerbolExplorer said:

Is there a way to make Texture replacer allow kerbals take off there suits at Duna?

 

Add Duna to atmSuitBodies and lower atmSuitPressure to 1 or below, whatever is the surface pressure on Duna.

does the RangeMachine build still need to be listed? It looks like you fixed the reflections in the latest release right?

Also can anyone tell me what stupid mistake I'm making here with the latest version under KSP v1.4.5 w/MH?

nevermind! Sorted it out. I copied the filename from the OP and it put a null character at the end of the string. You literally couldn't see it, you just had to press the arrow key twice to move the cursor past it.

Spoiler

I can see the female heads fine. There are some heads without the normal map and they don't show up either. The filename looks right. KSP Log

I'll prob figure it out after I wake back up if no one else has before then...

 

Edited August 9, 2018 by Drew Kerman
I'm a little confused - TextureReplacer was abandoned for some time, and TRR took over. Is it now merged back to TR, since TRR is not marked as compatible with 1.4.x?

1 hour ago, infinite_monkey said:

I'm a little confused - TextureReplacer was abandoned for some time, and TRR took over. Is it now merged back to TR, since TRR is not marked as compatible with 1.4.x?

This is the original, and the mod author has been maintaining compatibility but not adding new features. TRR is adding new features

4 hours ago, infinite_monkey said:

I'm a little confused - TextureReplacer was abandoned for some time, and TRR took over. Is it now merged back to TR, since TRR is not marked as compatible with 1.4.x?

They're still two different mods. Agree that it's potentially/still confusing. TRR may wish to give itself a bit of a different name, I guess.

Could @shaw make an option that where you can change on how much gloss there is on the EVA visor so I can see my Kerbal's face on EVA and also I don't want my Kerbal's gender being changed because of the head texture like for example Valentina was changed from a female to a male and I had to close 3 of my save games because of this before I could figure out how to fix it. I would thank you greatly.

14 minutes ago, Trekkie148 said:

Could @shaw make an option that where you can change on how much gloss there is on the EVA visor so I can see my Kerbal's face on EVA and also I don't want my Kerbal's gender being changed because of the head texture like for example Valentina was changed from a female to a male and I had to close 3 of my save games because of this before I could figure out how to fix it. I would thank you greatly. 

If you use stock, untextured visor, it's currently not transparent. That's a bug I noticed with KSP 1.4.5, but it may be there for a longer time. Use some suit textures (that include visor texture) and it should be ok. I'll try to fix it in the next release.

How did Valentina change gender? I removed legacyFemales option, TR should not touch genders any more. Please tell me the version of KSP, TR and the exact steps to reproduce this.

55 minutes ago, shaw said:

If you use stock, untextured visor, it's currently not transparent. That's a bug I noticed with KSP 1.4.5, but it may be there for a longer time. Use some suit textures (that include visor texture) and it should be ok. I'll try to fix it in the next release.

How did Valentina change gender? I removed legacyFemales option, TR should not touch genders any more. Please tell me the version of KSP, TR and the exact steps to reproduce this.

The latest texture replacer and KSP 1.4.5

@shaw would you possibly consider adding in the ability to locate texture files elsewhere within the GameData directory and point them towards TR using Module Manager configs? Something along the lines of: 

@TextureReplacer
{
    Directories
    {
        Default = GameData/Custom
        EnvMap = GameData/Custom/CustomSubFolder        
    }
}

And possibly even the ability to point to different file names for the textures, ala: 

@TextureReplacer
{
    TextureRename
    {
        GalaxyTex_PositiveX = SkyboxXP
        GalaxyTex_NegativeX = SkyboxXN      
    }
}

This would greatly increase the amount of interoperability/compatibility between mods that use TR without having to overwrite each other and causing issues down the like, especially in situations like installing through CKAN.

Edited August 13, 2018 by Poodmund

On 8/13/2018 at 10:23 PM, Poodmund said:

@shaw would you possibly consider adding in the ability to locate texture files elsewhere within the GameData directory and point them towards TR using Module Manager configs? Something along the lines of: 


@TextureReplacer
{
    Directories
    {
        Default = GameData/Custom
        EnvMap = GameData/Custom/CustomSubFolder        
    }
}

And possibly even the ability to point to different file names for the textures, ala: 


@TextureReplacer
{
    TextureRename
    {
        GalaxyTex_PositiveX = SkyboxXP
        GalaxyTex_NegativeX = SkyboxXN      
    }
}

This would greatly increase the amount of interoperability/compatibility between mods that use TR without having to overwrite each other and causing issues down the like, especially in situations like installing through CKAN.

No. I'm not adding additional complexity, I already threw out several features in 3.x and I'm looking forward to remove even more. You can already separate textures from different mods by putting them into subdirectories in `Skins/` and `Suits/`. And there is `paths` option for additional directories that act additional `Default/` subdir (well, good that I spotted this, that's the next feature in line for removal, I will rather make subdirs inside `Default/`, same as in `Skins/` and `Suits/`).

Okay, no worries, that's quite disappointing to hear as I was looking to be able to make my mods compatible with Texture Replacer, Texture Replacer Replaced and Sigma Replacements being able to swap each dependency out for another whilst still functioning without a hitch. Without the ability to path to textures in a custom folder it becomes hard for other mods to target my mod if necessary through a Module Manager patch.

In light of this, unfortunately I don't think I can support TR anymore as a dependency which is a big shame but it is your mod and I respect your decision to take it in this direction; if this does change in the future I would jump at the chance to add TR back as a dependency.

On 7/12/2018 at 11:03 PM, Avera9eJoe said:

Yeah - TRR is what WindowShine is currently running off. @Trekkie148 was wanting me to revert to TR again as its updated for 1.4.4 - the reflection plugin sounds like its still down though.

Reflections work with visors now. I tested it.

5 minutes ago, Trekkie148 said:

Reflections work with visors now. I tested it.

If I recall right though the visor plugin is different than the one used on parts. Do you know if it works on parts?

2 minutes ago, Avera9eJoe said:

If I recall right though the visor plugin is different than the one used on parts. Do you know if it works on parts?

Umm I will check in a couple of minutes. I will let you know when I can. What download of windowshine should i use?

If I recall right though the visor plugin is different than the one used on parts. Do you know if it works on parts?

Also you could check the default cfg file...

Umm I will check in a couple of minutes. I will let you know when I can. What download of windowshine should i use?

Also you could check the default cfg file...

I'm gonna do some quick testing myself too but for plain TR you should try running the 1.2- download (WindowShineTR-v12.4)

4 minutes ago, Avera9eJoe said:

I'm gonna do some quick testing myself too but for plain TR you should try running the 1.2- download (WindowShineTR-v12.4)

Ok thank you but could you add lights to the command pods and habitats please because they don't work.

UPDATE: Reflections work in 1.4.5 If you use the most recent official release of TR, and WindowShine for KSP v1.2. That said, all the previous bugs with part highlighting not working are also back.

1 minute ago, Trekkie148 said:

Ok thank you but could you add lights to the command pods and habitats please because they don't work.

 I can't since that's a bug with the reflection shader and not with WindowShine. Going back to TR means all the highlighting and lighting bugs are also back again so I'm afraid I won't be doing any updates in this regard.

Edited August 21, 2018 by Avera9eJoe

2 minutes ago, Avera9eJoe said:

UPDATE: Reflections work in 1.4.5 If you use the most recent official release of TR, and WindowShine for KSP v1.2. That said, all the previous bugs with part highlighting not working are also back.

 I can't since that's a bug with the reflection shader and not with WindowShine. Going back to TR means all the highlighting and lighting bugs are also back again so I'm afraid I won't be doing any updates in this regard.

ok  Depressed.. Um i mean ok thanks for letting me know Pun indeded??????????

Hi, I've run into a problem twice now. I was on Minmus driving my rover when suddenly I see a massive amount of log spam for this Exception and then the game hangs. 

[EXC 13:45:07.123] NullReferenceException
	scatterer.DisableEffectsForTextureReplacer.OnPostRender ()
	UnityEngine.Camera:RenderToCubemap(RenderTexture, Int32)
	TextureReplacer.Script:Update(Boolean)
	TextureReplacer.Script:UpdateScripts()
	TextureReplacer.TRReflectionUpdater:Update()

I'm not sure if this is a Scatterer issue, or if it's Texture Replacer causing this problem. It doesn't CTD, but Windows then errors out saying KSP isn't responding, etc.

Can anyone shine a light on this issue? It's happened twice now when I crossed into a new biome, then using [x] Science!, I can click on experiments. Then it hangs.

For support, here's my most recent log: KSP Log 082218

Also, here's my current modlist (see below)
